climbs.name: Toxic Playboy
climbs.fa: Paul Van Betten, Richard Harrison, Bob Conz, Sal Mamusia

content.description: A few bolts have been added to the lower pitch providing a very nice 12a pitch. The upper pitch is considerably harder than the 12b rating the Handren book gives it. Probably 12c/d.
content.location:
First route on the left side of the cliff. The crux (on the 1st pitch) is a pumpy section in the middle of the pitch.

 The top pitch was beyond my climbing ability. So I'm just guessing at the 12c/d rating.

content.description: This one seemed harder than the 11d rating the Handren book give is. It's a little loose going out the crux bulge otherwise this would get more stars and probably be the best route on the cliff. A couple of bots were added to eliminate the death run out to the anchors.
Tricky move at the bottom and pumpy. Bolts were added along with a nice anchor. Stick clip the second bolt.
content.location: Second route from the left side of the cliff.

climbs.name: Jimmy Nap
climbs.fa: Same as all the routes on this cliff

content.description: Awkward moves at the bottom. Bolts were added along with a nice anchor. Not the best route on the cliff. Worth doing once so you can get the tick.
Probably the best route on the cliff. We had to glue on the critical hold at the crux. Steep and fingery at the start. Pulling the bulge is the crux. Eases up after that.

This cliff is high in the gully. It's the highest cliff you see as you're driving from the second pullout and nearing the third. Bolts and anchors have been added to all routes. This is now a very nice sport cliff and well worth visiting. It's shady in the afternoon.
